result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael R Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael R Lewis was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment.  Follow up care and treatment. Take all prescribed medications by a treating physician.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
AODA assessment. Follow up care and treatment. Random urine screens. No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological DNA to the State Crime lab for testing.
As a a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms/weapons at any time in the future.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment form received and filed.

Fine of $1,800.00, and mandatory DNA fee.  To be paid from  up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance due prior to the end of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
*Court waived the mandatory costs, fees and assessments with the exception of the DNA fee.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA/SENTENCING commencing MARCH 3, 2017 received and filed. (63 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION

Defendant Michael R Lewis in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael R Lewis in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:   COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 38 MONTHS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 66 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
The Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Court WAIVED the mandatory costs, fees, and assessments with the exception of the DNA fees.
*  Court ordered the Defendant to pay the DNA fee up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications by a treating physician.
*  Pay a fine of $1,800.00 up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/weapons at any time in the future.
*  30 MONTHS suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  30 MONTHS Ignition Interlock Device.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Michael R Lewis in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael R Lewis in custody.   Megan Carmody for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The BAC number missing in the Complaint.  Court modifies Complaint adding the BAC as .241.   Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 and COUNT 3 DISMISSED. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.   Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Michael R Lewis not in court, in custody.  
James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing.  Defense request for adjournment heard and granted by the Court; no objection from the state.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Michael R Lewis not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Defense not prepared to proceed on today; request for adjournment granted.  New date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Michael R Lewis not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael R Lewis in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael R Lewis in custody.  Ronald Dague on behalf of James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael R Lewis in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Michael R Lewis in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of Defendant as to Counts 2 & 3 preserving Defendant's right of substitution.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
